content.text:
[@daan2](@Bk5uzkFxdMJnJR+rKVd+X4LO/u+8VV+lA14e+XLabXQ=.ed25519)

I think this is caused by [this file](https://github.com/ssbc/ssb-ws/blob/master/inject.js) which seems to have this behavior:

```js
if(config.ws) {
  port = config.ws.port
}

if(!port)
  port = 1024+(~~(Math.random()*(65536-1024)))

host = config.host || host
port = config.port || port
```

In my opinion this should probably read `connections.incoming.net.ws[]` for host + port + etc, that way we don't need to specify these properties in:

- config.X
- config.ws.X
- config.connections.incoming.ws[].X

Also: this *should* work without any `~/.ssb/config` at all -- what happens when you use the vanilla config? Or are there reasons that you need to modify the vanilla config?
